children.value: The Flyweight Pattern falls under the structural design patterns from the Gang Of Four.

is an object that minimizes memory usage by sharing as much data as possible with similar objects - a way to use objects in large numbers when a simple representation would use an unacceptable amount of memory.
many same objects are used and storage cost is high.
you can externalise a majority of each object's state.
few shared objects can replace many unshared ones.
identity of an object not relevant.
